meta.title: COVID-19 Plan - Boys’ Latin of Philadelphia

meta.name: description
meta.content: COVID-19 Plan - Boys’ Latin of Philadelphia

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: COVID-19 Plan, Boys’ Latin of Philadelphia
COVID-19 Plan - Boys’ Latin of Philadelphia
COVID-19 Plan - Boys’ Latin of Philadelphia

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout fsSection560 fsHasTheme2

span.i: Boys' Latin remains committed to safety and learning. Please find important updates and information regarding COVID-19 (coronavirus) and our school's plan of action here.

div.div: Click here for an update from Dr. Tennant about virtual clubs beginning next week!
Click here for an important update from Dr. Tennant regarding distance learning through the end of the 2019-20 school year.
Click here for an important update from Dr. Tennant regarding extended school closure and our Continuity of Education Plan.
Click here for an important message regarding specialized services for middle school students from Ms. Smith.
Click here for an important message regarding specialized services for high school students from Ms. Younkers.

Click here to read an update from Dr. Tennant that announces the extension of our school closure. Due to our previously scheduled spring break, the earliest we will return to school is April 14, 2020.
Click here to read an update from Dr. Tennant about our distance learning plan for the week of March 23 - March 27.
Click here to read a message from Dr. Tennant about our ongoing distance learning program and how to best support your Warriors!

Our distance learning plan, as communicated to students and families on March 13, is still in effect through March 27. The School District of Philadelphia's decision to end remote instruction does not apply to Boys' Latin of Philadelphia.
Click here to learn more about the emotional supports available to students during this period of school closure.
All students must begin checking their Google Classrooms and Boys' Latin email daily.
Click here to read a reminder from Dr. Tennant that distance learning for all students begins tomorrow!
The Philadelphia Public League has postponed all athletic contests through April 15, 2020. Athletics practices will resume when school does on March 30, 2020.
Boys' Latin of Philadelphia will be closed from March 16, 2020 through March 27, 2020. Click here to read the announcement from Dr. Tennant for full detail on our plan of action.
Click here to read a message from Dr. Tennant about COVID-19 and distance learning.
Click here to read a message from Dr. Tennant about coronavirus.

During this period of distance learning, our mission remains the same: to prepare boys for success in college and beyond. To learn more about our school's approach to distance learning, please review our Continuity of Education Plan and supplemental resources below.

div.p: Students will have the opportunity to receive breakfast and lunch during our school's closing. Non-perishable breakfast and lunch items will be available for pick-up as outlined in the school-specific plans below. Students or their family members can come to the front lobby of their respective school (high school or middle school), check in, and receive breakfast and lunch items for the week.

div.div: On the dates listed below, students or their family members may pick up a week's worth of breakfast and lunch between 8:00AM and 10:00AM.
Boys' Latin High School is located at 5501 Cedar Avenue Philadelphia, PA 19143.
On the dates listed below, students or their family members may pick up a week's worth of breakfast and lunch between 8:00AM and 10:00AM.
Boys' Latin Middle School is located at 344 N. Felton Street Philadelphia, PA 19139.

div.p: Students in 10th, 11th, and 12th grade have already received student Chromebooks from the school. Additionally, the majority of Boys' Latin families have reported having access to technology tools at home. However, students without technology access may take advantage of the limited number of Chromebooks we have available as loaners. In order to secure a loaner Chromebook, a student must email the IT Team with their name and grade level in advance of the designated pick-up dates so their laptop can be prepared. Please see the school-specific distribution plan below. If you are unable to attend one of the below dates, please email the IT Team to coordinate an alternative plan with you.

div.div: 5501 Cedar Avenue Philadelphia, PA 19143

div.em: To borrow a Chromebook, students must email their name and grade level to the IT Team no later than 12:00PM on Tuesday, March 24.

div.div: 5501 Cedar Avenue Philadelphia, PA 19143

div.em: To borrow a Chromebook, students must email their name and grade level to the IT Team no later than 11:59PM on Monday, March 23.

div.div: 5501 Cedar Avenue Philadelphia, PA 19143

div.em: Students may pick up loaner Chromebooks (if arranged in advanced) from the IT Team.

div.div: 5501 Cedar Avenue Philadelphia, PA 19143

div.em: Students may pick up loaner Chromebooks (if arranged in advanced) from the IT Team.

div.div: 344 N. Felton Street Philadelphia, PA 19139

div.em: To borrow a Chromebook, students must email their name and grade level to the IT Team no later than 12:00PM on Tuesday, March 24.

div.div: 344 N. Felton Street Philadelphia, PA 19139

div.em: To borrow a Chromebook, students must email their name and grade level to the IT Team no later than 11:59PM on Monday, March 23.

div.div: 344 N. Felton Street Philadelphia, PA 19139

div.em: Students may pick up loaner Chromebooks (if arranged in advanced) from the IT Team.

div.div: 344 N. Felton Street Philadelphia, PA 19139

div.em: Students may pick up loaner Chromebooks (if arranged in advanced) from the IT Team.

div.p: During this period of distance learning, a variety of resources are available to students and families to support continued academic growth and achievement.

div.a: Teacher Office Hours for High School Students
Teacher Office Hours for Middle School Students

div.div: To find your teacher's email address, search for their name on the Faculty & Staff page.

Our distance learning educational program is designed to meet the individual learning needs of all of our students. Click here for a list of frequently asked questions from our Office of Specialized Services.

Xfinity WiFi is now free for everyone. For a map of hotspots, visit www.xfinity.com/wifi. Once at a hotspot, select the "xfinitywifi" network name in the list of available hotspots and then launch a browser.
Comcast Internet Essentials is now $9.95/month plus tax for qualifying households. To learn more and sign up, click here.
To learn how to join a Google Classroom, click here for step-by-step directions (thanks Mr. Fletcher!).
If you need help troubleshooting Google Classroom, click here for the Google Classroom Help page.
Parents, click here for the Google Chromebook Guide for Guardians.
Parents, to help your student use their Chromebook, click here for the Google Chromebook Help page.

div.p: Our students remain our priority. School is closed, but we know the hardships and emotional struggles that accompany adolescence do not just go away. Furthermore the impact of COVID-19, the sudden change in daily routines, the absence of friends and loved ones, may cause anxiety to rise. Perhaps now more than ever, our students are grappling with stress, worry, or fear.

Our school social workers are here to help! For support, resources, and tools to cope with these difficulties please contact Yolanda Morales, High School Social Worker, at ymorales@boyslatin.org or Kenneth Bourne, Middle School Social Worker, at kbourne@boyslatin.org.
For the most up-to-date information about the novel coronavirus COVID-19 from the CDC click here.
To receive important information and updates from the Philadelphia Department of Public Health text COVID to 888-777.
Have questions about COVID-19? Call the 24/7 Greater Philadelphia Coronavirus Helpline at 800-722-7112 to speak with a medical professional regarding your concerns.

For a list of steps you can take to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and protect your families and communities, click here to check out the City of Philadelphia's Cronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) website.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: Distance learning will continue through the end of the 2019-20 school year. Please click here for our Continuity of Education Plan and important updates on our response to COVID-19.
